challenge.description: Rapid cooling during post-processing led to deviations in cation distribution.
challenge.impact: Rapid cooling caused Mn ions to remain on A-sites, disrupting the ideal cation distribution and affecting magnetic properties.

solution.description: Extremely slow cooling was suggested to achieve the ideal cation distribution.
solution.effectiveness: Effective in reducing deviations in cation distribution, but the process requires precise control.

evidence.data: Rapid cooling resulted in altered cation distribution, as evidenced by changes in magnetic properties and Curie constants.
